elements.title: Mazdutide versus dulaglutide in Chinese adults with type 2 diabetes
elements.contents:
Mazdutide versus dulaglutide in Chinese adults with type 2 diabetes

  • Lixin Guo
  • Bo Zhang
  • Wenying Yang
Article17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Mazdutide versus placebo in Chinese adults with type 2 diabetes
elements.contents:
Mazdutide versus placebo in Chinese adults with type 2 diabetes

  • Dalong Zhu
  • Jiajun Zhao
  • Lei Qian
Article17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Transient hepatic reconstitution of trophic factors enhances aged immunity
elements.contents:
Transient hepatic reconstitution of trophic factors enhances aged immunity

Using lipid nanoparticle delivery of mRNAs to the liver in aged mice, T cell function and declining immune cues can be restored.

  • Mirco J. Friedrich
  • Julie Pham
  • Feng Zhang
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Gene-specific selective sweeps are pervasive across human gut microbiomes
elements.contents:
Gene-specific selective sweeps are pervasive across human gut microbiomes

Development and application of the integrated linkage disequilibrium score (iLDS) reveals both selective pressures impacting the human gut microbiome and the mechanisms by which gut bacteria adapt to meet them.

  • Richard Wolff
  • Nandita R. Garud
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: GTP release-selective agonists prolong opioid analgesic efficacy
elements.contents:
GTP release-selective agonists prolong opioid analgesic efficacy

Mu opioid receptor agonists with a preference for the non-GTP-bound state of the G protein promote GTP release, thereby potentiating antinociceptive effects of drugs such as morphine and fentanyl without also increasing their respiratory or cardiac effects.

  • Edward L. Stahl
  • Matthew A. Swanson
  • Laura M. Bohn
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Programmable 200 GOPS Hopfield-inspired photonic Ising machine
elements.contents:
Programmable 200 GOPS Hopfield-inspired photonic Ising machine

An architecture inspired by Hopfield networks based on a programmable, stable, room-temperature optoelectronic oscillator-based photonics Ising machine is introduced that can be used to efficiently address optimization and combinatorics problems.

  • Nayem Al-Kayed
  • Charles St-Arnault
  • Bhavin J. Shastri
Article17 Dec 2025

elements.title: An integrated view of the structure and function of the human 4D nucleome
elements.contents:
An integrated view of the structure and function of the human 4D nucleome

The 4D Nucleome Project demonstrates the use of genomic assays and computational methods to measure genome folding and then predict genomic structure from DNA sequence, facilitating the discovery of potential effects of genetic variants, including variants associated with disease, on genome structure and function.

  • Job Dekker
  • Betul Akgol Oksuz
  • Feng Yue
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Palaeometabolomes yield biological and ecological profiles at early human sites
elements.contents:
Palaeometabolomes yield biological and ecological profiles at early human sites

Metabolic and proteomic profiles derived from fossilized skeletal remains of animals enable inferences regarding physiological health and disease as well as diet to provide reconstructions of ancient soil, vegetation and palaeoclimate characteristics.

  • Timothy G. Bromage
  • Christiane Denys
  • Thomas A. Neubert
Article17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Astrocyte CCN1 stabilizes neural circuits in the adult brain
elements.contents:
Astrocyte CCN1 stabilizes neural circuits in the adult brain

Neural circuits in adult mouse visual cortex are stabilized by astrocytes, which secrete CCN1, resulting in reduced plasticity and increased maturation of multiple cell types.

  • Laura Sancho
  • Matthew M. Boisvert
  • Nicola J. Allen
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: An 11-qubit atom processor in silicon
elements.contents:
An 11-qubit atom processor in silicon

An 11-qubit atom processor comprising two precision-placed nuclear spin registers of phosphorus in silicon is shown to achieve state-of-the-art Bell-state fidelities of up to 99.5%.

  • Hermann Edlbauer
  • Junliang Wang
  • Michelle Y. Simmons
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: The global hydrogen budget
elements.contents:
The global hydrogen budget

Trends in global H2 sources and sinks are analysed from 1990 to 2020, and a comprehensive budget for the decade 2010–2020 is presented.

  • Zutao Ouyang
  • Robert B. Jackson
  • Andy Wiltshire
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Visualizing interaction-driven restructuring of quantum Hall edge states
elements.contents:
Visualizing interaction-driven restructuring of quantum Hall edge states

Scanning tunnelling microscopy is used to image pristine electrostatically defined quantum Hall edge states in graphene with high spatial resolution and demonstrate their interaction-driven restructuring.

  • Jiachen Yu
  • Haotan Han
  • Ali Yazdani
Article17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Prevalence of Alzheimer’s disease pathology in the community
elements.contents:
Prevalence of Alzheimer’s disease pathology in the community

The prevalence of Alzheimer’s disease neuropathological changes is reported based on blood-based biomarkers in a Norwegian population-based cohort.

  • Dag Aarsland
  • Anita Lenora Sunde
  • Nicholas J. Ashton
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Titan’s strong tidal dissipation precludes a subsurface ocean
elements.contents:
Titan’s strong tidal dissipation precludes a subsurface ocean

Reanalysis of radiometric data from Cassini indicates that Titan does not contain a subsurface ocean, as strong tidal dissipation observed in its gravity field is not consistent with the presence of a liquid layer.

  • Flavio Petricca
  • Steven D. Vance
  • Jonathan I. Lunine
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Human assembloids recapitulate periportal liver tissue in vitro
elements.contents:
Human assembloids recapitulate periportal liver tissue in vitro

Hepatocyte organoids derived directly from human tissue enable long-term hepatocyte expansion and can be combined with portal mesenchyme and cholangiocyte organoids to form a donor-specific periportal liver assembloid system.

  • Lei Yuan
  • Sagarika Dawka
  • Meritxell Huch
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Spatiotemporal cellular map of the developing human reproductive tract
elements.contents:
Spatiotemporal cellular map of the developing human reproductive tract

A detailed spatiotemporal roadmap of the human female and male reproductive tracts during key periods of sexual differentiation provides new cellular and molecular insights into how early axial gradients lead to specific cell lineages and tissue structures.

  • Valentina Lorenzi
  • Cecilia Icoresi-Mazzeo
  • Roser Vento-Tormo
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Lesion-remote astrocytes govern microglia-mediated white matter repair
elements.contents:
Lesion-remote astrocytes govern microglia-mediated white matter repair

After spinal cord injury, lesion-remote astrocytes acquire heterogeneous, spatially restricted reactivity states that shape neuroinflammation, neural repair and neurological recovery.

  • Sarah McCallum
  • Keshav B. Suresh
  • Joshua E. Burda
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Laser spectroscopy and CP-violation sensitivity of actinium monofluoride
elements.contents:
Laser spectroscopy and CP-violation sensitivity of actinium monofluoride

Gas-phase actinium monofluoride (AcF) has been produced and spectroscopically studied at the CERN-ISOLDE radioactive ion beam facility; the results highlight the potential of 227AcF for exceptionally sensitive searches of CP violation.

  • M. Athanasakis-Kaklamanakis
  • M. Au
  • X. F. Yang
ArticleOpen Access17 Dec 2025

elements.title: 3D nanolithography with metalens arrays and spatially adaptive illumination
elements.contents:
3D nanolithography with metalens arrays and spatially adaptive illumination

A three-dimensional (3D) nanofabrication platform based on metalens-generated focal spot arrays is introduced to parallelize two-photon lithography beyond centimetre-scale write field areas, revealing the potential of 3D nanolithography towards wafer-scale production.

  • Songyun Gu
  • Chenkai Mao
  • Xiaoxing Xia
Article17 Dec 2025

elements.title: Fasting boosts breast cancer therapy efficacy via glucocorticoid activation
elements.contents:
Fasting boosts breast cancer therapy efficacy via glucocorticoid activation

Beneficial effects of fasting combined with endocrine therapy for oestrogen receptor-α-expressing breast cancers can be recapitulated using exogenous glucocorticoid receptor ligands instead of fasting to reduce harmful effects.

  • Nuno Padrão
  • Tesa M. Severson
  • Wilbert Zwart
ArticleOpen Access10 Dec 2025
